title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)) for the purpose of giving further effect to
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (National Car Test)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (National Car Test) 

(Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited road traffic (national car test) (amendment) (no 2) regulation 2020

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)) for the purpose of giving further effect to
heading: 2. The Road Traffic (National Car Test) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 415 of
text_raw:
2. The Road Traffic (National Car Test) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 415 of 

2017) are amended - 

(a) 

in Regulation 2, in paragraph (1), by the substitution of the 
following definition for the definition of ‘test certificate’: 

“‘test certificate’ means, in relation to a vehicle, a 
certificate issued under section 18, in accordance with 
Regulation 11, which is in the form set out in Schedule 
1;”, 

(b) 

in Regulation 11, by the substitution of “the issuing authority 
shall issue a certificate under section 18” for “the issuing 
authority shall issue a test certificate”, 

(c) 

in Regulation 13, in paragraph (1), by the deletion of “and 
Regulation 18”, 

(d) by the substitution of the following Regulation for Regulation 18: 

“EU Roadworthiness certificates, test due dates for 
vehicles in respect of which roadworthiness certificate in 
force

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)) for the purpose of giving further effect to
heading: 18. (1) An EU roadworthiness certificate issued in
text_raw:
18. (1) An EU roadworthiness certificate issued in 
respect of a vehicle that was registered in a Member State, 
other than the State, and which is brought into the State, 
other than temporarily where the vehicle is the subject of 
an exemption under section 135 of the Finance Act (No. 9 
of 1992), in circumstances which require the vehicle to be 

1 OJ No. L 127, 29.4.2014, p. 51. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 1st December, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [555] 3 

registered in the State in accordance with section 131 of 
that Act, shall remain in force until it expires or is 
otherwise cancelled or revoked. 

(2) 

(a) Subject to subparagraph (b), where an EU 
roadworthiness certificate expires or is 
otherwise cancelled or revoked, the date of 
such expiry, cancellation or revocation, as 
the case may be, shall be the first test due 
date for the vehicle in respect of which the 
certificate was issued and each subsequent 
test due date shall be determined in 
accordance with Regulation 3. 

(b) Where 

the 

expiry, 

cancellation or 
revocation of an EU 
roadworthiness 
certificate occurred on a date in the period 
beginning on 28 March 2020 and ending on 
31 July 2020 - 

(i) 

(ii) 

the first test due date for the vehicle 
in respect of which the certificate is 
issued shall be the date that is 4 
months after the date of such expiry, 
cancellation or revocation, as the 
case may be, and 

each subsequent test due date shall be 
the date that is 4 months after each 
date that is determined in accordance 
with Regulation 3 to be a test due 
date for the vehicle. 

(3) Where there is a doubt as to the validity of an EU 
roadworthiness certificate, the issuing authority may 
verify the validity of the certificate with the Member State 
competent authority concerned.”, 

and 

(e) 

by the deletion of Regulation 19. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 November, 2020. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [555]

title: Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)) for the purpose of giving further effect to
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations determine the test due dates for an imported vehicle where a 
roadworthiness certificate was issued by another Member State in respect of that 
vehicle and that certificate continues to be in force. The Regulations permit the 
verification of roadworthiness certificates issued by other Member States where 
the validity of the certificate is in doubt. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [555] 5
